did.unittitle: American Philosophical Society Archives. Record Group IId
did.abstract:
This is part of the large inventory for the American Philosophical Society Archives. For complete information concerning this collection, please view the
Collection Description.

did.unittitle: An historical account of the origin and formation of the American philosophical society held at Philadelphia for promoting useful knowledge;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: June 19, 1840. A.D. 70 leaves End: 5 Nov. 1841 - withdrawn by the author for revision under resolution of the Socy. of this date. Bound with this are: [P.S. Du Ponceau] to Committee of APS - Franklin Bache, John K. Kane, Alexander D. Bache, and Robley Dunglison - Sept. 1,1841, relative to publishing his paper and that of J.F.Fisher on the history of APS. - 12p. Report of Committee to whom were referred the papers of P.S. Du Ponceau and J.F. Fisher in re history of APS; Oct. 15,1841;- Robley Dunglison - 57p. with 3 app. - (a) Statement of the attendance of members at meetings from 1758 to 1768 - 1p.; (b) Abstract from Junto minute book - 37p.; and (c) Chronological statement - 13p. All of the above material, except for Du Ponceau's letter of Sept. 1, 1841 and the attendance chart, is printed: 506.73:Am43, pp.1-136. Not found May, 2011.

did.unittitle: Report of committee on paper by [Elias] Loomis;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, D.S.: Sears C. Walker, R. M. Patterson, and E. Otis Kendall. 1p. and end. See APS Proceedings, IV, 112.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: London, 1 p., address and endorsement. A.L.S. Acknowledges receipt of order for £13.2.9. Bequest of [Nathan] Dunn. [Charles] Waterton sends copy of his last work, to go by the next packet.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Printed L.filled in in ms.S.: Nich[olas] Carlisle. 1p.,end.and add. Thanks for Proceedings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, 2 pp., address and endorsement. A.L.S. Inquires whether the A.P.S. would be interested in publishing his work on the magic cyclovolute. See Pro., IV, 125.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [London], 1p. and endorsement. L.S.: Nich[hola]s Carlisle. Forwards to the A.P.S.: Archaeologia, XXX, and index to vols. XVI-XXX.

did.unittitle: Letter to the Corresponding Secretary of the A.P.S.,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Meredith, 1 p., address and endorsement. A.L.S. Sends "Tables" to the A.P.S. for calculating the moon Laplace

did.unittitle: Letter to the Secretary of the A.P.S.,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: U.S. Legation, Copenhagen, 1p. and endorsements. L.S. U.S. minister transmits a donation from [N.C.L.] Abrahams, cited herein, to the A.P.S.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Treasurer of A.P.S., London, 1 p., address and endorsement. A.L.S. Sends per T. P. Cope: Altona journals; British Almanac for 1845; packet from the Linnean Society [of London].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Treasurer of A.P.S., London, 1 p., address and endorsement. L.S. Forwards a parcel from the Statistical Society and one from the Leeds Philosophical and Literary Society to the A.P.S.

origination.corpname: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, Printed L.filled in in ms.S.: Walter R. Johnson. 1p. ,end.and add. Thanks for publication.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Librarian of A.P.S., Philadelphia, 1p,. address and endorsement Wishes to use designated issues of the Comptes rendus de l'Academie, and will call for the same at the library of the A.P.S.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: New York, Printed L.filled in in ms.S.: George Gibbs. 1p.,end.and add. Thanks for Transactions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [Philadelphia], 2 pp. address and endorsement. A.L.S. Advises against the publication of [John] Ewing's magic square.

scopecontent.p: Turin, Printed L.filled in in ms.S.: Joseph Gené 1p.,end.: A.L.E[lwyn] and add. In French. Thanks for Transactions and Proceedings

scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, D.S.: Ch. D. Meigs and Robley Dunglison. 1p. end. See APS Proceedings, IV, 124-125.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Secretary of A.P.S., West Point, 1 p., address and endorsement. A.L.S. Accepts membership on committee to collect observations on solar eclipse of the 9th instant. See Pro., IV, 134.

did.unittitle: Report of committee on paper by [E. Nulty] on the "Different forms of the magic cyclovolute";

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [Philadelphia] D.S.: R. M. Patterson and Ellwood Morris. 1p., end. See APS Proc., IV, 125-126. Printed: APS Trans., n.s., X, 17-25.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Princeton, 1 p., address and endorsement. A.L.S. Regarding the dentition of the mastodon. See Pro., IV, 126-127.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Librarian of A.P.S., Washington, 1 p., address and endorsement. Does not expect to be in Philadelphia on January 3. Extends New Year greetings to Mr. Ord. FILM 235 FRAME 33
